results.title: Light in the jungle
results.creator_credit: Seventh Day Adventist Public Relations Dept
results.brief_description: The challenge of the South Pacific. Fiji has a coconut based economy which has produced new wealth and new problems for the people; learning the value of labour and the use of money. Tells of the combined efforts of government officials and missionaries to solve these problems. Graduates of the Seventh Day Adventist Medical Training College in Lae, New Guinea, help village people learn personal hygiene, and sanitation as well as how to overcome fears and superstitions.

results.title: Light in the darkness
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and K Khandpur
results.brief_description: Today there are more than 50 schools for the blind in India where children as well as adults receive education and training. The Central Braille Printing Press at Dehra Dun is dedicated to serving the sightless. The training centre for the adult blind, also located at Dehra Dun, is one of the most important centres of its kind in the country. Weaving is among the principal technical trades taught.

results.title: Light illumination and its measurement
results.brief_description: Illustrates the common sources of artificial light and explains their operation. Describes in detail the measurement of light, indicating luminous intensity, luminous flux and illumination. Explains and demonstrates such basic terms as candle power, lumen and foot-candle.
results.description: Illustrates the common sources of artificial light and explains their operation. Describes in detail the measurement of light, indicating luminous intensity, luminous flux and illumination. Explains and demonstrates such basic terms as candle power, lumen and foot-candle.

results.title: Light flight
results.brief_description: A non-narrated production about helicopters. Shows the loading and unloading of the helicopter, the flight and the spectacular aerial view of iced waterways.

results.title: Light control through polarisation
results.creator_credit: Moviegram Films and Loucks and Norling Studios
results.brief_description: Sketches the nature of light waves, the focusing of a light beam, the spectrum and the use of color filters. Diagrams are employed to explain the theory of polarisation.

results.title: Light and shade
results.creator_credit: Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Discusses light and shade as one of the basic elements of design. To the trained eye, light and shade reveal form, provide dramatic effect, establish harmony or mood and create decorative patterns. This film conveys that elements of design are inherent in the patterns of nature and are effectively employed in works of art

results.title: Light and dark
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Studies light and shadow, and graduations of color to illustrate the meaning of values in art. Encourages children to find out, by experimentation with light and dark objects, what value is, what it does, and how it makes them feel.

results.title: Light
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Photosynthesis is the process by which a plant converts the energy from sunlight into sugars in specialised cells called chloroplasts. Respiration is the releasing of energy stored in sugars in the parts of the cells called mitochondria. The manipulation of light to simulate the natural habitat, shows how plant science can measure the relationship between light level and growth to determine optimum growing conditions.

results.title: Lifting patients. Part 2. In the home
results.creator_credit: Kinocraft and Great Britain. Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: Demonstrates lifting techniques and explains the principle on which they are based, which removes the possibility of spinal injuries and strain. Primarily for district nurses, health visitors and others in the field of domiciliary nursing and could also be extremely useful to relatives who are nursing patients at home.
